oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: History, Ancient
Classical literature
Mythology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The fragment gives a brief narrative of events at Troy subsequent to the death of Achilles. The events described are as follows: 1/ (lines 1-10) Expedition of Odysseus and Diomedes to the Trojan citadel in quest of the Palladium, where they kill Corybus, son of Mygdon; 2/ (lines 11-14) Voyage of Odysseus and Phoenix to Scyros to fetch Neoptolemus, who receives from Odysseus the arms of Achilles; 3/ Arrival of Eurypylus, son of Telephus, from Mysia. Written in large uncials.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mythological Fragment
